essay.question-text: Using points and examples from the talk, explain the two techniques presented in the talk.
essay.sample-answer-text:
SAMPLE ANSWER
In this talk, the professor discusses two different techniques to convince someone else to do what you want.
The first technique is the foot-in-the-door technique. Using this technique, if you want something large—such as a car—you start by asking for something small—such as a bicycle. The other person will tend to give you something large after he or she has already given you something small.
The second technique is the door-in-the-face technique. Using this technique, if you want something small—such as a bicycle—you start by asking for something big—such as a car—and the other person will refuse it. The other person will tend to give you something small after first refusing to give you something large.
